page.title: 13ORWELL PARK SCHOOL
page.content: Orwell Park used to be the home of Admiral Vernon,who introduced Grog to the Royal Navy. It passed into the Tomlin family. Colonel Tomlin built the railway line to Felixstowe so that it could rival Harwich as a port. Now it is a Preparatory Boarding School for boys aged 6 to 13. The curriculum is similar to that of a State School with the addition of Latin,French, German and Greek. There are excellent facilities for Sports and activities. Music practice rooms have been built in the cellars and every boy learns to play a musical instrument. To save money each boy has to do ten minutes housework daily.When they leave, the boys usually go to Public Schools. In the dome there is the seventh largest privately owned telescope in Great Britain. This belongs to the Ipswich Astrological Society.
